ground_truth: Quintana looks at Walter, and Jesus walks away as Walter nods sadly. We are looking down at the Dude who is prone on the rug, his eyes closed, wearing a Walkman headset. The Dude absently licks his lips as we faintly hear a hall rumbling down the lane. In his outflung hand lies a cassette case labeled VENICE. On its impact with the pins, the Dude opens his eyes, and a blonde woman looms over him. Next to her, a young man in paint-spattered denims stoops and swings something towards the carrier as a million stars explode against a field of black. The Dude is flying over the city, his arms thrown out in front of him, the wind whipping his hair and billowing his bowling shirt. Ahead, the mysterious blonde woman wings away, riding on the Dude's rug like a sheik on a magic carpet. She is outpacing us, growing smaller, and he looks up. The Dude does a couple of lazy crawl strokes and then notices that a bowling ball has materialized in his forward hand. His bemusement turns to concern over the aerodynamic implications just as the ball seems to suddenly assume its weight, abruptly snapping his arm down, and him after it. He is falling, and from a high angle, we see the Dude hurtling down toward the city, dragged by the ball. A reverse looking up shows the Dude hurtling toward us out of the inky sky, his eyes wide with horror. Led by the bowling ball, he zooms past the camera leaving us in black as dull reflections materialize in the darkness. They are glints off the shiny surface of an oncoming bowling ball. We pull back to reveal that the blackness was the inside of a ball return, and the gleaming bowling ball is being regurgitated up at us, overtaking us. The Dude looks up, up, up at the looming ball, its mass rolling a huge shadow across his face. The gleaming ball shows three dead black holes rolling toward us--finger holes--and the largest--thumb--hole rolls directly over us, engulfing us once again in black. The black rolls away and we are spinning--spinning down a bowling lane--our point of view that of someone trapped in the thumbhole of the rolling ball. We see the receding bowler spinning away; it is the blonde woman, performing her follow-through. Floor spins up at us and then away; ceiling spins up and away; the length of the alley with pins at the end; floor; ceiling; approaching pins; again and again. We hit the pins and clatter into blackness as we see pins spin, hit each other, and drop. They come from the Dude's Walkman, the headset of which is now askew, with one arm off his ear.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Quintana gazes at Walter, and Jesus strides off as Walter bobs sadly. We are staring down at the Dude who is supine on the rug, his eyes shut, wearing a Walkman headset. The Dude idly moistens his lips as we faintly hear a hallway rumbling down the lane. In his outstretched hand rests a cassette case labeled VENICE. On its impact with the pins, the Dude opens his eyes, and a blonde woman towers over him. Next to her, a young man in paint-speckled denims bends and swings something toward the carrier as a million stars burst against a field of black. The Dude is soaring over the city, his arms flung out in front of him, the wind lashing his hair and billowing his bowling shirt. Ahead, the enigmatic blonde woman wings away, riding on the Dude's rug like a sheik on a magic carpet. She is outstripping us, growing smaller, and he glances up. The Dude does a couple of lazy crawl strokes and then discerns that a bowling ball has emerged in his forward hand. His perplexity turns to apprehension over the aerodynamic implications just as the ball appears to suddenly assume its weight, abruptly yanking his arm down, and him after it. He is plummeting, and from a high angle, we see the Dude plunging down toward the city, dragged by the ball. A reverse looking up shows the Dude plunging toward us out of the inky sky, his eyes wide with terror. Led by the bowling ball, he zooms past the camera leaving us in black as dull reflections emerge in the darkness. They are glints off the shiny surface of an approaching bowling ball. We pull back to disclose that the blackness was the interior of a ball return, and the gleaming bowling ball is being regurgitated up at us, overtaking us. The Dude glances up, up, up at the looming ball, its mass rolling a huge shadow across his face. The gleaming ball shows three dead black apertures rolling toward us--finger holes--and the largest--thumb--hole rolls directly over us, engulfing us once again in black. The black rolls away and we are whirling--whirling down a bowling lane--our point of view that of someone confined in the thumbhole of the rolling ball. We see the receding bowler whirling away; it is the blonde woman, executing her follow-through. Floor spins up at us and then away; ceiling spins up and away; the length of the alley with pins at the end; floor; ceiling; approaching pins; repeatedly. We hit the pins and clatter into blackness as we see pins spin, collide with each other, and drop. They emanate from the Dude's Walkman, the headset of which is now askew, with one arm off his ear.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Walter is looked at by Quintana, and Jesus is walked away from as a sad nod is given by Walter. We are looking down at the Dude, who is prone on the rug, his eyes closed, wearing a Walkman headset. The lips of the Dude are licked absently by him as a hall is faintly heard rumbling down the lane. In his outflung hand, a cassette case labeled VENICE lies. The Dude opens his eyes as the pins are impacted, and a blonde woman is looming over him. Next to her, a young man in paint-spattered denims stoops and swings something towards the carrier as a field of black is exploded against by a million stars. The city is flown over by the Dude, his arms thrown out in front of him, his hair being whipped by the wind and his bowling shirt billowing. Ahead, the mysterious blonde woman is winging away, riding on the Dude's rug like a sheik on a magic carpet. She outpaces us, growing smaller, and he looks up. A couple of lazy crawl strokes are done by the Dude, and then he notices that a bowling ball has been materialized in his forward hand. His bemusement is turned to concern over the aerodynamic implications just as the ball seems to suddenly assume its weight, abruptly snapping his arm down, and him after it. The Dude falls, and from a high angle, we see the city being hurtled down toward by him, dragged by the ball. Looking up in reverse shows the Dude hurtling toward us out of the inky sky, his eyes wide with horror. The bowling ball leads him, and he zooms past the camera, leaving us in black as dull reflections materialize in the darkness. Glints off the shiny surface of an oncoming bowling ball are revealed by us. That the blackness was the inside of a ball return is revealed as we are pulled back, and the gleaming bowling ball is overtaking us, being regurgitated up at us. The Dude looks up, up, up at the looming ball as a huge shadow is rolled across his face by its mass. Three dead black holes--finger holes--are shown rolling toward us in the gleaming ball--and the largest--thumb--hole rolls directly over us, engulfing us once again in black. Spinning--spinning down a bowling lane--we are, our point of view that of someone trapped in the thumbhole of the rolling ball. The receding bowler is seen spinning away; it is the blonde woman, and her follow-through is performed. The floor spins up at us and then away; the ceiling spins up and away; the length of the alley with pins at the end; floor; ceiling; approaching pins; again and again. The pins are hit by us and blackness is clattered into as pins are seen spinning, hitting each other, and dropping. They come from the Dude's Walkman, the headset of which is now askew, with one arm off his ear.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Quintana looks at Walter as Jesus walks off and Walter nods sadly. The camera shows the Dude lying on a rug, eyes closed, wearing a Walkman. He licks his lips as we faintly hear a ball rumbling. A cassette labeled VENICE rests in his outstretched hand. When the ball strikes the pins, the Dude opens his eyes to see a blonde woman looming. Beside her, a young man in paint-stained jeans swings something toward the carrier, triggering a starburst against black. The Dude soars above the city, arms outstretched, hair and shirt flapping. The blonde woman glides ahead on the Dude's rug like a sheik on a magic carpet, shrinking as she speeds away. He looks up, swims lazily, then notices a bowling ball in his hand. Concerned by its sudden weight, he’s yanked downward. From above, we see him falling toward the city, dragged by the ball. From below, he plummets toward us, eyes wide. The scene cuts to glints on a bowling ball’s surface. We zoom out from inside the ball return as the ball rushes forward. The Dude stares at it as its shadow engulfs him. Three black finger holes approach—thumb hole swallows us in darkness. We spin down a lane from inside the ball, watching the bowler—the blonde woman—recede. Floor, ceiling, alley, pins spin repeatedly. We strike the pins and crash into blackness as they tumble. The Walkman's headset now sits askew, one arm off the Dude’s ear.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Quintana looks at Walter, and Jesus walks away as Walter nods sadly. We see the Dude lying on the rug, eyes closed, wearing a Walkman. He licks his lips as a hall rumbles faintly. A cassette labeled VENICE is in his hand. On impact with the pins, he opens his eyes to see a blonde woman above him. A young man in paint-spattered denims swings something, and stars explode against black. The Dude flies over the city, arms out, wind whipping his hair and shirt. The blonde rides his rug like a magic carpet, outpacing him. He notices a bowling ball in his hand, which snaps his arm down, dragging him toward the city. He hurtles down, led by the ball, eyes wide with horror. The ball zooms past the camera, leaving us in black. We see glints off a bowling ball inside a ball return. The ball looms over the Dude, casting a shadow. Its finger holes roll toward us, engulfing us in black. We spin down a bowling lane, trapped in the thumbhole. The blonde woman spins away, performing her follow-through. We hit the pins, clattering into blackness as pins spin and drop. The Dude's Walkman headset is askew, one arm off his ear.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Quintana turns his gaze toward Walter, and as he does so, Jesus begins to walk away, leaving Walter to nod with a sense of sadness. Our perspective shifts to look down upon the Dude, who is lying prone on the rug. His eyes are closed, and he is wearing a Walkman headset, which adds a touch of nostalgia to the scene. The Dude absentmindedly licks his lips, and in the background, we can faintly hear the sound of a hall rumbling down the lane. In his outstretched hand, there lies a cassette case with the label VENICE prominently displayed. As the cassette makes its impact with the pins, the Dude's eyes suddenly open, and he finds himself looking up at a blonde woman who looms over him. Beside her, a young man dressed in paint-spattered denims bends down and swings something toward the carrier, creating a spectacular visual of a million stars exploding against a backdrop of deep black. 

The Dude is now soaring over the cityscape, his arms extended in front of him, with the wind whipping through his hair and causing his bowling shirt to billow dramatically. Ahead of him, the enigmatic blonde woman is flying away, riding on the Dude's rug as if she were a sheik on a magical carpet. She is moving faster than us, gradually becoming smaller in the distance, and the Dude looks up to follow her. He performs a couple of lazy crawl strokes through the air and then notices, with a sense of surprise, that a bowling ball has appeared in his forward hand. His initial bemusement quickly shifts to concern as he contemplates the aerodynamic implications, just as the ball seems to suddenly gain its full weight, snapping his arm downward and pulling him along with it. 

He begins to fall, and from a high vantage point, we observe the Dude plummeting toward the city below, dragged relentlessly by the bowling ball. In a reverse shot, looking upward, we see the Dude hurtling toward us out of the dark, inky sky, his eyes wide with horror and disbelief. Led by the bowling ball, he zooms past the camera, leaving us enveloped in blackness as dull reflections start to materialize in the darkness. These reflections are glints off the shiny surface of an oncoming bowling ball. As we pull back, it becomes clear that the blackness was the inside of a ball return, and the gleaming bowling ball is being regurgitated up toward us, overtaking our view. The Dude looks up, up, up at the looming ball, its massive form casting a huge shadow across his face. The gleaming ball reveals three dead black holes rolling toward us—finger holes—and the largest of them, the thumb hole, rolls directly over us, engulfing us once more in blackness.

The darkness rolls away, and we find ourselves spinning—spinning down a bowling lane—with our point of view that of someone trapped within the thumbhole of the rolling ball. We see the receding bowler spinning away; it is the blonde woman, gracefully performing her follow-through. The floor spins up at us and then away; the ceiling spins up and away; the length of the alley with pins at the end; floor; ceiling; approaching pins; again and again. We hit the pins and clatter into blackness as we witness the pins spinning, colliding with each other, and ultimately dropping. The sounds emanate from the Dude's Walkman, the headset of which is now askew, with one arm hanging off his ear.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Quintana slowly turns his gaze toward Walter, and as he directs his attention in this manner, Jesus begins to walk away. This leaves Walter standing there, nodding with a sense of lingering sadness. From our perspective, we shift to an overhead view, looking down upon the Dude, who is lying flat on the rug beneath him. His eyes are peacefully closed, and he is wearing an old Walkman headset, which imbues the scene with a nostalgic charm. With a seemingly absentminded gesture, the Dude licks his lips softly, and in the faint distance, we can just barely hear the sound of a hall rumbling down the lane. In his outstretched hand, there is a cassette case prominently labeled with the word VENICE. As the cassette achieves contact with the pins, the Dude's eyes snap open with sudden awareness, and he finds himself gazing upward at a blonde woman who is looming over him. Beside this woman, a young man clad in paint-spattered denims crouches down and swings something toward the carrier, creating a spectacular visual of a million stars bursting against the pitch-black backdrop.

Now, the Dude is soaring majestically over the wide cityscape below, his arms outstretched in front of him, with the wind whipping through his hair, causing his bowling shirt to flap dramatically in the breeze. Ahead, the mysterious blonde woman is flying away, riding on the Dude's rug as if she were a sheik on an enchanted, magical carpet. She is moving faster than we are, gradually becoming smaller as she fades into the distance, and the Dude looks upward, following her with his gaze. He executes a couple of lazy crawl strokes through the airy expanse and then notices, with a hint of surprise, that a bowling ball has inexplicably appeared in his forward hand. His initial bemusement shifts quickly to growing concern as he contemplates the aerodynamic implications of this development, just as the ball suddenly seems to gain its full weight, snapping his arm downward and pulling him along with its force.

As he begins to fall, from a high vantage point, we observe the Dude plummeting toward the sprawling city below, relentlessly dragged by the weight of the bowling ball. In a reverse shot, looking upward into the sky, we witness the Dude hurtling toward us out of the dark, inky expanse, his eyes wide open with horror and disbelief. Led by the bowling ball, he zooms past the camera, leaving us enveloped in utter blackness as dull reflections start to materialize within the darkness. These reflections are mere glints off the shiny surface of an oncoming bowling ball. As our view pulls back, it becomes clear that the blackness was, in fact, the inside of a massive ball return, with the gleaming bowling ball being regurgitated up toward us, overtaking our entire view. The Dude looks up, up, up at the ominous bowling ball, its massive form casting an enormous shadow across his face. The gleaming ball reveals three dark, abyssal holes—finger holes—rolling toward us, and the largest of them, the thumb hole, rolls directly over us, once again engulfing us in blackness.

As the darkness rolls away, we find ourselves in a dizzying spin—spinning down the familiar length of a bowling lane—with our perspective that of someone trapped within the thumbhole of the rolling ball. We see the receding bowler spinning away; it is the blonde woman, gracefully executing her follow-through. The floor spins up toward us and then away again; the ceiling spins up and away too; the length of the alley with pins at its end; floor; ceiling; approaching pins; again and again, this cycle repeats. At last, we hit the pins with force and clatter into blackness as we witness the pins spinning, colliding with one another, and ultimately falling to their rest. The sounds are emanating from the Dude's Walkman, whose headset is now askew, with one arm hanging gently off his ear.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Quintana fixes his gaze on Walter, who returns the look with a nod that carries a weight of sadness, while Jesus silently turns and walks away. Our perspective shifts downward to the Dude, who is lying prone on the rug, his eyes gently closed, and a Walkman headset resting over his ears. As he lies there, seemingly lost in his own world, he absentmindedly licks his lips, and in the background, the faint rumble of a hall echoes down the lane. In his outstretched hand, a cassette case labeled VENICE rests, and as the sound of impact with the pins reaches him, the Dude's eyes flutter open to reveal a blonde woman looming over him. Beside her, a young man dressed in paint-splattered denims bends down and swings something towards the carrier, causing a cascade of a million stars to explode against a backdrop of black. Suddenly, the Dude finds himself soaring over the city, his arms extended in front of him, the wind rushing through his hair and causing his bowling shirt to billow. Ahead of him, the enigmatic blonde woman glides away, riding on the Dude's rug as if she were a sheik on a magic carpet, gradually becoming smaller as she outpaces him. The Dude glances upward, performing a couple of lazy crawl strokes, when he notices a bowling ball has mysteriously appeared in his forward hand. His initial bemusement quickly shifts to concern as he contemplates the aerodynamic consequences, just as the ball seems to gain weight, yanking his arm downward and pulling him along with it. He begins to plummet, and from a high vantage point, we observe the Dude being dragged down toward the city by the bowling ball. A reverse angle shows the Dude hurtling toward us from the dark sky, his eyes wide with terror. The bowling ball leads the way as he zooms past the camera, leaving us enveloped in blackness, which gradually reveals dull reflections. These reflections are glints off the shiny surface of an approaching bowling ball. As we pull back, it becomes clear that the darkness was the interior of a ball return, and the gleaming bowling ball is being ejected toward us, overtaking our view. The Dude looks up at the looming ball, its massive shadow rolling across his face. The ball's surface reveals three deep black holes—finger holes—rolling toward us, with the largest thumb hole rolling directly over us, plunging us once more into darkness. As the blackness recedes, we find ourselves spinning down a bowling lane, our perspective that of someone trapped within the thumbhole of the rolling ball. We catch sight of the receding bowler, spinning away; it is the blonde woman, gracefully completing her follow-through. The floor spins up toward us and then away, followed by the ceiling, the length of the alley with pins at the end, floor, ceiling, and the approaching pins, over and over. We collide with the pins, clattering into darkness as we witness the pins spinning, striking each other, and toppling. They emerge from the Dude's Walkman, the headset now askew, with one arm slipping off his ear.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Quintana exchanges a sad nod with Walter as Jesus departs. Meanwhile, the Dude lies on the rug with his eyes closed, wearing a Walkman headset. He licks his lips absentmindedly as the sound of a hall rumbling down the lane becomes faintly audible. A cassette case labeled VENICE rests in his outstretched hand. Upon hearing the impact with the pins, the Dude opens his eyes to see a blonde woman looming over him. Beside her, a young man in paint-spattered denims swings something toward the carrier, causing a burst of stars against a black field. The Dude finds himself flying over the city, arms extended, with the wind whipping his hair and bowling shirt. The mysterious blonde woman rides ahead on the Dude's rug like a sheik on a magic carpet, gradually outpacing him. As he performs a few lazy crawl strokes, a bowling ball materializes in his hand, shifting his bemusement to concern as it suddenly gains weight, pulling him down. He plummets toward the city, dragged by the ball, his eyes wide with horror. The ball leads him past the camera, leaving us in darkness, which transitions to the shiny surface of an oncoming bowling ball. We pull back to reveal the blackness as the inside of a ball return, with the bowling ball emerging toward us. The Dude looks up at the looming ball, its shadow rolling across his face. The ball's finger holes approach, and the thumb hole engulfs us in blackness. As the blackness recedes, we spin down a bowling lane, viewing from the perspective of someone trapped in the thumbhole. The receding bowler, the blonde woman, performs her follow-through. The floor and ceiling spin alternately as we approach the pins, hitting them and clattering into blackness. Pins spin, collide, and fall, originating from the Dude's Walkman, now askew with one arm off his ear.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Quintana, known locally as a skilled bowler infamous for his intense rivalry with Walter, looks at Walter, and Jesus, their mutual acquaintance and fellow bowler with a penchant for flashy moves, walks away as Walter nods sadly. We are looking down at the Dude, known for his laid-back lifestyle and love for the game, who is prone on the rug, his eyes closed, wearing a Walkman headset, a popular portable cassette player from the 80s. The Dude absently licks his lips as we faintly hear a hall rumbling down the lane, a sound familiar in any busy bowling alley. In his outflung hand lies a cassette case labeled VENICE, possibly a mixtape from his favorite vacation spot. On its impact with the pins, reminiscent of a strike in bowling, the Dude opens his eyes, and a blonde woman, who appears almost ethereal in her presence, looms over him. Next to her, a young man in paint-spattered denims, possibly an artist from the local community known for its vibrant art scene, stoops and swings something towards the carrier as a million stars explode against a field of black. The Dude is flying over the city, his arms thrown out in front of him, the wind whipping his hair and billowing his bowling shirt, a garment he wears as a personal trademark. Ahead, the mysterious blonde woman wings away, riding on the Dude's rug like a sheik on a magic carpet, initiating a fantastical flight over the sprawling cityscape below. She is outpacing us, growing smaller, and he looks up. The Dude does a couple of lazy crawl strokes, evoking the leisurely style of his everyday life, and then notices that a bowling ball has materialized in his forward hand. His bemusement turns to concern over the aerodynamic implications just as the ball seems to suddenly assume its weight, abruptly snapping his arm down, and him after it. He is falling, and from a high angle, we see the Dude hurtling down toward the city, dragged by the ball, a metaphor for the gravity of life's unexpected turns. A reverse looking up shows the Dude hurtling toward us out of the inky sky, his eyes wide with horror. Led by the bowling ball, he zooms past the camera leaving us in black as dull reflections materialize in the darkness. They are glints off the shiny surface of an oncoming bowling ball, emblematic of the sport's unpredictable nature. We pull back to reveal that the blackness was the inside of a ball return, an essential mechanism in any bowling alley, and the gleaming bowling ball is being regurgitated up at us, overtaking us. The Dude looks up, up, up at the looming ball, its mass rolling a huge shadow across his face. The gleaming ball shows three dead black holes rolling toward us--finger holes--and the largest--thumb--hole rolls directly over us, engulfing us once again in black. The black rolls away and we are spinning--spinning down a bowling lane--our point of view that of someone trapped in the thumbhole of the rolling ball. We see the receding bowler spinning away; it is the blonde woman, performing her follow-through, a display of her expert bowling form. Floor spins up at us and then away; ceiling spins up and away; the length of the alley with pins at the end; floor; ceiling; approaching pins; again and again. We hit the pins and clatter into blackness as we see pins spin, hit each other, and drop. They come from the Dude's Walkman, the headset of which is now askew, with one arm off his ear.

Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. Led by the bowling ball he zooms past the camera leaving us in black as dull reflections materialize in the darkness. They are glints off the shiny surface of an oncoming bowling ball. We pull back to reveal that the blackness was the inside of a ball. return and the gleaming bowling ball is being regurgitated up at us overtaking us. The Dude looks up up up at the looming ball its mass rolling a huge shadow across his face. The gleaming ball shows three dead black holes rolling toward usfinger holesand the largestthumbhole rolls directly over us engulfing us once again in black. The black rolls away and we are spinningspinning down a bowling laneour point of view that of someone trapped in the thumbhole of the rolling ball. We see the receding bowler spinning away. it is the blonde woman performing her followthrough. Floor spins up at us and then away. ceiling spins up and away the length of the alley with pins at the end floor ceiling approaching pins again and again. We hit the pins and clatter into blackness as we see pins spin hit each other and drop. They come from the Dude's Walkman. the headset of which is now askew with one arm off his ear.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Quintana looks at Walter and Jesus walks away as Walter nods sadly. We are looking down at the Dude who is prone on the rug his eyes closed wearing a Walkman headset. The Dude absently licks his lips as we faintly hear a hall rumbling down the lane. In his outflung hand lies a cassette case labeled VENICE. On its impact with the pins the Dude opens his eyes and a blonde woman looms over him. Next to her a young man in paintspattered denims stoops and swings something towards the carrier as a million stars explode against a field of black. The Dude is flying over the city his arms thrown out in front of him the wind whipping his hair and billowing his bowling shirt. We see the receding bowler spinning away. it is the blonde woman performing her followthrough. Floor spins up at us and then away. ceiling spins up and away the length of the alley with pins at the end floor ceiling approaching pins again and again. We hit the pins and clatter into blackness as we see pins spin hit each other and drop. They come from the Dude's Walkman. the headset of which is now askew with one arm off his ear.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: McKinley inspects Franklin, and Artemis drifts forward as Franklin shrugs cheerfully. We are staring up at the Pirate who is crouched on the sand dune, his eyes open, wearing an astronaut helmet. The Pirate absentmindedly hums a tune as we loudly hear a tower collapsing up the hill. In his clenched fist rests a floppy disk labeled ATLANTIS. Upon its contact with the coconuts, the Pirate closes his eyes, and a redheaded woman hovers beside him. Beside her, an elderly lady in ink-stained leggings crouches and flings something towards the wagon as a billion fireworks burst against a sheet of white. The Pirate is swimming under the ocean, his legs stretched out behind him, the current tossing his scarf and flapping his parka. Behind, the enigmatic redheaded woman drifts closer, gliding on the Pirate's dune like a mermaid on a floating shell. She is approaching us, growing larger, and he glances down. The Pirate performs a couple of rapid backstrokes and then realizes that a basketball has appeared in his left foot. His excitement turns to confusion over the gravitational consequences just as the basketball seems to unexpectedly gain its mass, swiftly tugging his leg up, and him alongside it. He is ascending, and from a low angle, we see the Pirate soaring up toward the ocean surface, lifted by the basketball. A forward gaze shows the Pirate soaring away from us into the bright sky, his eyes filled with surprise. Propelled by the basketball, he drifts above the camera leaving us in light as vivid patterns emerge in the brightness. They are flashes off the frosted surface of an approaching basketball. We push forward to reveal that the brightness was the interior of a cloud chamber, and the glowing basketball is being launched down at us, passing us. The Pirate glances down, down, down at the approaching basketball, its weight casting a small silhouette over his face. The glowing basketball reveals three bright white marks spinning toward us—light marks—and the tiniest—glow—mark spins directly beneath us, enveloping us once more in light. The light spins away and we are rotating—rotating up a narrow path—our perspective that of someone caught in the glow mark of the spinning basketball. We observe the departing batsman rotating close; it is the redheaded woman, executing her swing. Sky revolves above us and then fades; sand rotates close and fades; the width of the path with boulders at the start; sky; sand; nearing boulders; repeatedly and repeatedly. We strike the boulders and shatter into light as we notice boulders circle, strike each other, and tumble. They emerge from the Pirate's helmet, the visor of which is now diagonal, with one side above his eye.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Quintana glances at Walter, who nods sadly as Jesus walks away. Meanwhile, the Dude lies on the rug wearing a Walkman headset. A cassette labeled VENICE is in his hand, and with a crash, a blonde woman appears above him. A young man swings an object, triggering a vision where the Dude flies over the city like a superhero. The blonde woman rides on the Dude's rug, flying swiftly. The Dude swims through the air until a bowling ball materializes in his hand, pulling him down toward the city. His terror grows as he plummets, led by the ball, until he falls into blackness. We realize we're inside a bowling ball's thumbhole. The ball rolls with the Dude trapped, spinning toward and hitting the pins, which clatter and fall as the scene fades to black, revealing the Dude's askew Walkman.
